meanings.definition: Acidophiles: organisms that thrive in acidic environments
meanings.sent1: The acidophiles in the soil prefer to live in areas with high acidity levels.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study acidophiles to understand how they survive in harsh acidic conditions.
meanings.sent3: The acidophiles at the party were the ones who loved the sour candies the most.
meanings.sent4: In a world of sweet-loving creatures, acidophiles stand out like brave warriors in a sea of sugar.
meanings.sent5: Imagine acidophiles as tiny warriors battling through the acidic jungles of their habitat.

meanings.definition: Acidophiles: a group of microorganisms that can survive in low pH conditions
meanings.sent1: The acidophiles found in the hot springs have adapted to the extreme pH levels.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are fascinated by the resilience of acidophiles in harsh acidic environments.
meanings.sent3: The acidophiles in the lab seemed to be having a 'sour' party under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: In the world of microorganisms, acidophiles are like the daredevils of the low pH realm.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, acidophiles look like tiny superheroes conquering the acidic challenges.
